body:
**Description of the problem**

When placing symbols on lines with `plot -S~:+sk+ap` the symbol is not always oriented in the direction of line construction. 

**Full script that generated the error**

```
cat > dir.def << END
-0.5   0.25 M
 0.5   0    D
-0.5  -0.25 D
-0.5   0.25  0.3 c -W- -Gred
-0.5  -0.25  0.3 c -W- -Ggreen
END

cat > pathWE+ap.txt << END
>
-0.5   0.4
 0.5   0.6
>
-0.5   0
 0.5   0
>
-0.5  -0.4
 0.5  -0.6
END

cat > pathEW+ap.txt << END
>
 0.5   0.6
-0.5   0.4
>
 0.5   0
-0.5   0
>
 0.5  -0.6
-0.5  -0.4
END

cat > pathWE_v+ap.txt << END
-0.5  0.5
 0    0.5
 0   -0.5
 0.5 -0.5
END

cat > pathEW_v+ap.txt << END
 0.5 -0.5
 0   -0.5
 0    0.5
-0.5  0.5
END

cat > pathWE_n+ap.txt << END
-0.5  0.5
-0.5 -0.5
 0.5  0.5
 0.5 -0.5
END

cat > pathEW_n+ap.txt << END
 0.5 -0.5
 0.5  0.5
-0.5 -0.5
-0.5  0.5
END

cat > pathWE_z+ap.txt << END
-0.5  0.5
 0.5  0.5
-0.5 -0.5
 0.5 -0.5
END

cat > pathEW_z+ap.txt << END
 0.5 -0.5
-0.5 -0.5
 0.5  0.5
-0.5  0.5
END

gmt begin symbol_orientation png
  gmt subplot begin 4x2 -Fs8c -M5p -A -Bwsentr -Bag1d -R-1/1/-1/1 -JM8c -T"Symbol Orientation @%10%-S~:+sk+ap@%%"
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathWE+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n1:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathWE+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathWE+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathEW+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n1:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathEW+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathEW+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathWE_v+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n1:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathWE_v+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathWE_v+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathEW_v+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n1:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathEW_v+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathEW_v+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathWE_n+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n3:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathWE_n+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathWE_n+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathEW_n+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n3:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathEW_n+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathEW_n+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathWE_z+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n3:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathWE_z+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathWE_z+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
    gmt subplot set
      gmt basemap
      gmt plot pathEW_z+ap.txt -W2p,darkgrey,8_4 -S~n3:+skdir/1c+p2p,black+gwhite+ap
      gmt plot pathEW_z+ap.txt -SqN-1:+i+l" START "
      gmt plot pathEW_z+ap.txt -SqN+1:+i+l" END "
  gmt subplot end
gmt end show
```

**Actual outcome**

![symbol_orientation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45796239/107160139-b0f73780-6994-11eb-8101-dd7c39ee81b3.png)


**Expected outcome**

Except for panels a) & d) all panels show one or more errors where the symbol isn't oriented along the line with the tip pointing towards the end of the line. I expect all symbols to be oriented parallel to the line pointing towards the end.

**System information**

* GMT version (`gmt --version`): 6.2.0_64f1fda_2021.02.06

comments_content.body: The issue has to do with the angle calculation.  Most of this was piggy-backed off very similar quoted lines and contour labeling operations, but in those case we usually only care about orientation and not direction (we are not going to place a label upside down, for instance).  So they way I compute the angle from nearby points does not preserve direction.  I don't think this will be a hard fix.

title: plot -S~:+sk+ap – Symbol should always follow along the line
